evaluate

Matrix evaluate(java.lang.String[] tokenList)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Evaluate the given operations with the given matrices.

Parameters:
tokenList - Operators and Matrices (right handside).
Returns:
The resulting matrix.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When there is an error in the given input.

paranthesis

int[] paranthesis(java.lang.String row,
                  java.lang.String col)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Give the integer values of the row and column given in paranthesis. If there is a : in paranthesis, corresponding value will be -1, else (value - 1) will be returned because row and column numbers given in shell are starting from 1 and in the Matrix class, these are starting from 0

Parameters:
row - String representation of the row.
col - String representation of the column.
Returns:
int[] which contains row and column numbers, respectively.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When there is a wrong input in paranthesis.

eval

Matrix eval(Matrix M,
            int row,
            int col)
      throws java.lang.Exception
Give the requested matrix with row and col values. If row is -1, column col; else if col is -1 row row is returned. Else, a matrix which contains the element in the row and col numbers of the original matrix is returned.

Parameters:
M - Original matrix.
row - Requested row number.
col - Requested column number.
Returns:
The resulting matrix.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When there is an error in the row or column values.

eval

Matrix eval(java.util.ArrayList varList,
            java.util.ArrayList opList)
      throws java.lang.Exception
Evaluate the given operations with given matrices. Operations cannot be ' or ( . This function is used by evaluate function.

Parameters:
varList - List which contains the matrices and scalar values.
opList - List which contains operations.
Returns:
The resulting matrix.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When there is an error (mostly dimensions of matrices do not match).

takeInput

java.lang.String[] takeInput()
Take the input line by line, parse and return the parsed input.

Returns:
The parsed input.

control

void control()
Take the input, check which input is entered and call appropriate methods to handle all kinds of inputs. Stops working when user enters "exit" command.

print

void print(java.lang.String varName,
           int row,
           int col)
     throws java.lang.Exception
Print the given matrix. If both of row and col is -1, print the entire matrix, else if one of them is -1, print the given row or col, else print the element.

Parameters:
varName - Name of the matrix.
row - Row number.
col - Column number.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When given input contains errors.

The resulting matrix.

java.lang.Exception - When columns entered false.

randomize

Matrix randomize(java.lang.String row,
                 java.lang.String col,
                 java.lang.String minVal,
                 java.lang.String maxVal,
                 java.lang.String integerFlag)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Create a new matrix which contains random floating points.

Parameters:
row - Row number of the matrix.
col - Column number of the matrix.
minVal - Minimum random value.
maxVal - Maximum random value.
integerFlag - If true, elements of the matrix will be integers.
Returns:
The resulting matrix.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When taken String inputs are not integers or doubles.

construct

                 java.lang.String col,
                 java.lang.String val)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Create a new matrix. All elements are initialized to a given double.

Parameters:

col - Column number of the matrix.
val - String representation of the double value.

The resulting matrix.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When the string inputs are not integers or double.

set

Matrix set(Matrix M,
           int[] rowAndCol,
           java.lang.String[] rhs)
     throws java.lang.Exception
Construct a new matrix or change the given vector or element of a matrix.

Parameters:
M - Initial matrix
rowAndCol - Row and column number to be changed. If both of them are -1, a new matrix will be constructed. Else if row is -1, a column vector is set to the given column number of matrix. Else if column is -1, a row vector is set to the given row number of the matrix. Else, a double value is set to the given row and column number of the matrix.
rhs - The matrix which will be evaluated and set to the correct place of the given matrix.
Returns:
Created or changed matrix.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When there is a dimension mismatch.

toDoubleArray

                           throws java.lang.Exception
Parse the given string array to double array.

Parameters:
inputStr - The string array to be parsed.
Returns:
Double array created from the string array.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If string array contains values different than double.

                 Matrix second,
                 java.lang.String oper)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Takes two matrices and returns the result of the given operation.

Parameters:
first - First Matrix.
second - Second Matrix.
oper - Operation ( *, - or + ).
Returns:
The resulting Matrix.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When the operation cannot be done (mostly because of the dimension mismatch).

                 double second,

           throws java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
first - First double.
second - Second double.
oper - Operation to be done.
Returns:
The result.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - When operation is different than *, + or -.
